translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Dhamma Section in Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  hetu sa hetuka duka
translated: The Dyad on Root and Root-Caused

original: Nahetuñceva naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva naahetuko ca dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Nahetuñceva naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko ceva na nahetu ca🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuñceva naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva🔽naahetuko ca naahetuko ceva na nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum ca iva na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati  hetu paccayā na hetum ca iva na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum ca iva na ahetukam ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva  na ahetuko ca na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a root-caused and rootless states as condition there arises the rootless and root-caused.🔽With a root-caused and rootless states as condition there arises the root-caused and rootless.🔽With a root-caused and rootless states as condition there arise the root-caused and rootless and the rootless and root-caused.

original: Naahetukañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko ceva na nahetu ca dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Naahetukañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva naahetuko ca
analyzed: na ahetukam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā na ahetukam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca
translated: With a rootless and root-caused state as condition there arises the rootless and root-caused.🔽With a rootless and root-caused state as condition there arises the root-caused and rootless.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naahetukañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na ahetukam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu
translated: With a rootless and root-caused state as condition there arises the root-caused and rootless and the rootless and root-caused.

original: ceva naahetuko ca naahetuko ceva na nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuñceva naahetukañca naahetukañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva naahetuko ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ca iva na ahetuko ca na ahetuko ca iva na na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na hetum ca iva na ahetukam ca na ahetukam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: and neither-conditions-for-conditions-that-are-not-roots, and neither-conditions-for-conditions-that-are-roots-and-not-roots arise.🔽… with a condition that is a root and not a condition that is a root and a condition that is not a root, a condition that is a root arises. …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava
translated: (In brief:) Nine with a root cause. Nine with object. … Nine with an immediate predecessor. … Nine with non-disappearance.

analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha vitthāro
translated: (In the section on “with origination,” etc., and in the section on the questions, all the triplets should be expanded in detail.)
